page.title: 14UPWOOD IN WORLD WAR II
page.content: When World War II broke out A.R.P.'s started patrolling the village ensuring everything was in order.One day some A.R.P.'s went to Mrs.Agger's house and told her not to polish her brass letterbox because it would shine in the moonlight and bombers would see it.When there were air_raids all the lights were turned out.In the village there is a house called Carlton House,it had a thatched roof but in the war a plane crashed into the back garden and set fire to the roof.Everyone helped to get valuables out of the house.During the blaze the mistress said, "Hang on, I've left my handbag." So she calmly went in and got it. By Peter Tim and Wayland
